intro: Inversodicraea minutiflora f. insolata, commonly known as the insular form of the species, is a rare and unique botanical variant. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, commonly known as the heath family. This plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and compact growth habit. It is typically found in specific microhabitats, often in shaded, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
